meanings.definition: To regard or treat with disapproval or dislike.
meanings.sent1: She was disfavouring the new policy changes at work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was disfavouring the student's disruptive behavior in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat was disfavouring the new brand of cat food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds disfavoured the outdoor picnic with an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: His constant complaints about the weather were disfavouring everyone's mood.

meanings.definition: To show disapproval or dislike towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The judge was disfavouring the defendant's lack of remorse during the trial.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help disfavouring the rude customer at the store.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man was disfavouring the noisy neighborhood kids playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The strict teacher disfavoured any form of cheating in her classroom.
meanings.sent5: The grumbling customer was disfavouring the slow service at the restaurant.
